comment: The curriculum, grading scale, and class schedule were all over the place. During the online class sessions she would ramble about random topics not limited to but including the birth of google, designing before computers, and how she used to work for her father. For a class called professional development she wasn't very professional.

I loved this class so much! Professor Sledd just wants the best for you. She can be hard to reach by email sometimes. There is group projects that can be hard especially with being online but if you work ahead you are good! You do have a large about of essays but that is expected, if you look at the rubric then you are good!

Take this from someone who took her 1101 and 2130 courses: just try. It's not that hard. Often, you don't even really have to read the assigned readings. The quizzes have multiple attempts, and she's pretty lenient on grammar with written assignments. Just try and you'll probably be okay. Fyi, for 1101, there's more writing than 2130.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: Class is centered around sustainability which is pretty awesome. The class is broken into three sections, the first being an essay about rhetoric examples, a podcast on sustainability (it's wasn't too bad actually), and then a final short essay reflecting on sustainability. Offers extracredit also! Stay on top of assignments and it's an easy class!

The whole course is trying to build a successful podcast regarding sustainability. It was supposed to be a group project, but I was able to convince her to do it solo. It was harder, but it paid off. 

Good prof overall, but I prob seek this as a 2nd choice.

have to open every link in content in order to see that there is a quiz/test during the week. doesnt have the quizzes on the announcements page because you cant see that its assigned until you open link. uses discord and cant copy and paste from word into it. gives mini essay quizzes with word count but on lockdown and cant see how many words typed

She is great at giving feedback and she gives either a discussion or quiz each week, not much work. You do have to read a lot!!!! I just don't like how she has us put our discussion on discord and all her quizzes (even essay's) are lockdown and webcam. It gets frustrating when you can retake a quiz and have to do the set up all over again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: While you don't need a textbook, you will need the money to rent movies as she has you watch 3 in one week without providing a way to watch them. also she has a group project even for her online classes.

The rubrics were simple and if I had any questions she would answer them. Throughout the semester, extra credit was offered which was helpful. I can tell she wants her students to do well with providing good feedback and lectures.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Sledd is clear, concise and consistent. Quizzes/Discussions with each week's module. 2 large scale projects, 1 being a group project. She is very good with communication and extremely flexible. Genuinely wants you to succeed. Do your work, and you'll do well!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: If you take Prof Sledd online, it's a fairly easy class. She gives plenty of time to do work. As the course goes on, it gets easier. Several group assignments as well as a critical group project--mine was a podcast. If you turn in your work, you'll do well. Her grading scale isn't hard to follow and pretty relaxed.

This class wasn't hard, the due dates for assignments give a lot of time to complete them. She gives great feedback, and her lectures are informative. The downsides are that she takes a while to grade and sometimes instructions aren't clear/she doesn't provide a project rubric. Overall, I would retake her.

If you're taking her online then expect a pretty easy class. Weekly assignments which are discussions in discord (she pings a lot so turn your notifications off for your sanity), a pretty tedious/boring group project, and a final paper to put a cherry on top (it's not that hard). Overall I wouldn't say she's a bad professor but isn't the best :P
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Sledd was very interesting. She based the whole course on labyrinths. There are weekly quizzes which are open note and discussions that take place on Discord. She gives 2-3 weekly readings and sometimes includes movies we have to watch. You can take the quizzes twice and she offers several extra credit opportunities.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Sledd was okay to say the least... I'm currently taking her for 2130 (not sure why that wasn't a choice). Very harsh grader, not clear instructions, honestly class was all over the place. One group project and a paper as a final. We had a quiz for a week, and she wanted us to direct quote a random line in the essay. Not open notes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: professor sledd was one of my favorite profs. in her prerecorded lectures, she would give in-depth explanations with her lecture slides as well as provide examples. her assignments made you think and also were really engaging. she was easy to reach and always interacting with her students. only downside is she took awhile to grade the assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I took her American Lit summer class. The workload is super easy and she answers emails relatively fast and gives good feedback. In the course we only had one quiz and the rest were discussions, and one final project. The only complaint is the time it takes to grade assignments and how late the assignments are released. Overall, I liked the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Online Savvy

comment: This class was ok. If you do the work, you'll probably get an A. There are 2 group projects. It takes her a while to grade things. She doesn't answer questions in a timely manner. Due dates were often wrong or changed. The content is boring. She uses Discord for most things too which is weird to me. Weekly quizzes are open book. No exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Do not take if you are taking other classes, have a life, and don't like being frustrated. She has so many nonsensical assignments it's a wonder why the department lets her "teach." If you have the time to waste writing and creating a podcast go for it (seriously). Seems like a sweet lady but this is not a fun elective, it's a mandatory course.
If you want to know anything about the actual class subject, don't take her course. It will be "themed" around something entirely different, and you will not learn about anything but that.

This class was very easy but the only problem is the group work was the main assignments that were worth the most, 2 group projects and an essay,  she took off points for meaningless things like font was too small or lack of collaboration and she would give a 60 or very low grade for those things brought down my grade to a C because of her grading.

Professor Sledd is an amazing professor. Her class was interesting and had a light course load. There are no tests or quizzes, but there are group projects and discussions but graded individual or have the option to do the project individually. As long as you know the basics of writing and keep up with your work, it's an easy a.

I did not have a problem with Professor Sledd one bit. Although, the course material was overwhelming. Unlike other lit classes, this whole semester was focused on Labyrinths and I got bored after a while. Discussions, quizzes, and learning activities over new material weekly. 2 exams, 1 group project, and an essay. Not bad, had some peers hate it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: As with most online classes, there are a great deal of discussion posts, but that's to be expected at this point. Professor Sledd, like the majority of English professors, is pretty quirky. That being said, as you can write semi-coherently and do the assignments, you'll get an A.

Professor Sledd is very clear with your assignment for the week. However, she focuses on strange material that other english classes do not cover. The material is hard to understand at times. Very nice professor, would not take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: I absolutely loved having Professor Sledd for English 1101! Her class was super interesting and the workload was pretty light. While there are no tests or quizzes, there are projects! She responds within a day to emails and is very specific to feedback. She also has some extra credit if you are struggling!

Prof Sledd is actually so cool. Her class is super interesting and she has a tonnn of extra credit. The quizzes are easy if you read the material which is (usually) not even that long. The tests are super free if you do the study guide. One 2-3 page paper in the class at the end and she's an easy grader. TAKE HER

Every single assignment is about a maze. Every. Single. One. A movie with a maze. A book with a maze. A letter or some random tv show, it doesn't matter. It's genuinely hilarious and I'm nearly laughing as I type this. Get ready for repetition, a lot of mind-numbingly boring reading, and lockdown quizzes. Definitely reconsider taking this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: If you want a teacher that requires a lot of reading, doesn't communicate as much as she should, and isn't too good with technology, Professor Sledd is perfect. Class is easy if you read and remember all the little random details. The final was heavily focused on details that are very unimportant. I'd stay away, there are much better English profs.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: She provided free versions of all the texts you'll read. The only thing I had to pay for was access to a movie we had to watch. The class builds on itself so make sure you are reading the assigned materials. Easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This is a World Literature course but she is OBSESSED with labyrinths. You are assigned 2-5 readings per week and must do a discord discussion and a lockdown browser quiz about EACH story and sometimes quizzes are hidden in the d2l module and can't be seen until you click every link. Don't take this prof unless you love mazes and/or are a Lit major
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: take her if you dont mind to read and actually put in a bit work, not saying she is that easy but she cares about her students and will work with you if you need help. lockdown quizzes, # of attempts depends on the reading, some have 4 attempts; 2 groups projects with lots of time to finish; and 2 tests
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Prof. Sledd was pretty decent. Work was just two or three readings a week with a quiz and discussions. The quizzes/tests use lockdown but you have two attempts. The quizzes are fine but the tests were very specific. Much of the reading was complex so you have to read some lines several times to understand it. Easy class for 1-2 hrs of work a week.

this was all online and met once a week, which was for extra help and attendance was extra credit!! there was a lot of work, but nothing too bad! provides readings/videos and then a 5 question quiz on them (yes it was lockdown BUT YOU GET 2 CHANCES TO TAKE IT! i recommend her for an easy A if you are willing to do work that's due@the end of week!

The class was easy and the assignments weren't too hard. She'll also work with you if you have a low grade. However, she rambles on and on about absolutely nothing. This is not a typical English class. She did no real teaching about anything regarding actual English mechanics rather just sustainability practices and how to save the Earth.

Good teacher and nice person. She tries her best to help her students learn while also being able to pass the class with no problems. She loves the idea of group work and wants her students to participate in class often. Professor Sledd aims to make her class the most beneficial for her students grade-wise and life-wise.

Professor Sledd was one of the most amazing professors I've ever had. She teaches you a lot of life information that is genuinely helpful and fun to know. I only wish I didn't take a hybrid so I could go to class more! The class is discussion-based. So if you have bad classmates, that will be the bane of the class, not the professor.

All we did in class was discussions about random topic based on sustainability, which was super interesting. But sometimes i even wonder why i showed up to class bc we did NOTHING. She is sooooo nice and easy going. Homework was a lot but her class was so easy i just did it the night before! Final is a podcast im currently working with my group!!

Amazing lectures that can open your eyes up to things if you go into them with a desire to learn. She's a very caring professor who will do her best to make sure that you do your best. If you're someone that is very set on your ways and don't find fun in expanding your worldview don't take up a seat for someone else that can benefit from this prof.

Of all the classes I've taken in my years at KSU, Professor Sledd's was my favorite. She assigns incredible, unusual projects, and her lectures are amazing. She's readily accessible, knowledgeable, artistic, and caring. If you don't care and are just taking this for the grade, leave the seat open for a student that can truly enjoy her class.

She's good, though she's kinda unorganized and doesn't give grades back very often. She loves group work. The final was even a group project which was weird to me for a lit class. She's a really great lecturer though, but you'll def need to listen for essay topics and test questions. She's pretty lenient with deadlines if you're a day or so late.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GROUP PROJECTS--Would take again

comment: Professor Sledd was great. If you do the readings online, study the powerpoints, and TAKE NOTES, you will get an A. TAKE NOTES on what she says in class, they will be on the tests and sometimes won't be on the power points. Would take again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Make sure you go to class, pay attention and you will be good to go.

For the sake of all things holy do not take this professor. Especially if you're any type of STEM major. Too many long papers about very ridiculous subjects with the exception one where you pick a subject to research. She takes her class very seriously and expects you to "write down 5pages of notes every class" can't take her seriously.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I took this class as a hybrid. The work goes week by week. She guides you through your writings (main grades) and is always open for feedback. She is very interactive and makes the classes interesting. We watch, discuss, and write on movies that are actually interesting to see. One discussion per week over your opinions on what you have read.

Disorganized and long winded. Tends to talk at length about nothing pertinent. Doesn't post assignments to D2L until the day before due date.  Complains about KSU/Polytechnic merger and uses this as an excuse to not learn new computer based systems (D2L). Very opinionated.

The biggest thing you have to understand about Sledd is she makes you work for your grade, and the work you do is relevant. She wants you to learn.. This is college guys, and it's time for you to grow up and be ready to put in the time for good grades. She is hands down one of the best professors I have ever had. Don't listen to the negativity.

Her classes were really easy. She does give pop quizzes, so make sure you do the readings. Readings are usually 2-5 pages, real easy. She gave us two projects and they were easy if you understand how to annotate. She has really in depth conversations in class and shows different points of views of the readings. Plus she can make you laugh.
Nice, fun, keeps it entertaining.
DONT USE TIMES NEW ROMAN!!!!

Here is the deal if you are looking for an easy A and don't really want to learn anything then look elsewhere, but if you want to leave college with marketable skills you should find this professor welcome.  The assignments are not that bad unless you wait until the last minute to do them and in that case it is completely your fault.

She's very harsh on grading written projects and will find even the tiniest detail to subtract points for.  She also assigns projects that are too detailed and too much work to be handled if taking a full course load and all but one were group projects.  Attendance is mandatory.  She didn't make us buy the book, thankfully.
Had a good time in this class. There was a fair amount of reading, but it was from articles she found. No textbook to buy. I would take her again if she is teaching any of the classes I need.

Hybrid class. Teacher gave clear guidelines when it came to the requirements for assignments and the class. Very energized class, with various group interaction. She is understanding if presented with a problem in a reasonable time prior to class.

Changes due dates without warning or notice, and finds any excuse to mark points off. I couldn't understand directions and asking her questions made things even more confusing. Examples of what to do are exactly what she says not to do. Ironic that a communications professor doesn't communicate properly. DO NOT TAKE.

Excellent teacher! Very fair and helpful. Assignments nicely relate to subject. Lectures are thoughtfully constructed and kept me engaged. Taking her again! Highly recommend her to anyone who is actually trying to get an education. She's very approachable and really cares about teaching so there really is no excuse for not doing well in her class.

Way too much busy work! This class is requires a lot of extra time just to do weekly assignments, not to mention she grades you by time spent in modules, rather than content. Group projects are very demanding, with little time. 10/10 would never recommend this professor or class!
Doesn't teach, just rambles all period. All course material is online. Directions make no sense, and harshest grader I've ever had. Feedback is never helpful. Avoid if at all possible.

This class consumed a lot of time. The projects in the class are ridiculous and seem unrelated to the course. Do not take this class if you are looking for an easy way to complete a college requirement.

One of the best literature teachers that I have ever had. Her methodology was that of the student discovering reoccurring themes in the course. Our book list was very appropriate and none of the reading was stupidly time consuming. She understands that her students are all taking 10+ more hours and work a job; a very down to earth person.

I took her special topics class on space. It was a bit abstract for me, and I couldn't quite get down the writing style that she was looking for. Great class for anyone looking for a creative class. The guidelines were extremely loose for all of our assignments which was beyond confusing for me. Easy class, but confusing for some.

Great professor. Had her for TCOM 2010 and American Lit 2. Very smart, sharp, and clear. She tries to help students get interested in the material, even though is boring at times. If you do the assigned readings and follow her instructions, you should get an A. Also take lots of notes (they help A LOT on quizzes)!
Her lectures are interesting, class is fun, but she is a harsh grader.

A pretty easy class, but she forces you to buy the book. I mean, she gives a quiz where you get a 0 if you don't bring your book to class. But you never use it the entire semester. Her lectures were also incredibly boring. There are only group projects and attendence quizzes as grades, apart from stupid stuff like the book quiz

She is a very calm instructor. She has alot of design skills which she'll tell you about. But in TCOM its all group projects...she is easily distracted and sometimes she a bit silly take this class if you have all stressful classes this will balance out your schedule

Took her for comp 1 and she was an awesome professor. Now I have her for tcomm. I dread her tcomm class because we're constantly forced to work on group projects back to back. I understand that she's trying to get us more comfortable with working with people but at least one solo project wouldn't hurt either!

I took her for Vampire Literature (special topic for Eng 1102)and she was a great teacher. She was interested in her subject and showed more movies which was nice. I love how we went in depth about the origins of the myths and compared past and present vampires. She is quite helpful at the end of the semester grade wise.
Smart. Skilled. Sharp as a tack. Good-natured. Great smile. Smokin' hot. Very motivating.

Her essay topics may be a bit tough, but she is very nice in giving second chances on work. She is willing to explain stuff more. Just do your best and she'll try to help you out :) She is a really really nice teacher. I got a high A and stayed there for most of the semester and I sucked at writing in high school!

She likes to teach and she is very merciful in giving us second chances. She expects near perfection on all the essays she assigns and she grades them hard. She is willing to help if you need it though.
She is alright teacher, she gives out lots of work and she grades all of them. Do not take this class if you don't like writing and if you're alright with grammer. She is very picky.
